votebox.middle.view

Interface IView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AView, AWTView

    public interface IView
    The IView is an interface that allows for the drawing of a Drawable element to the display. We have purposefully drawn an abstraction boundary here, at the interface between the ViewManager (better seen as the model's interface with the display) and the View, because we know that the view implementation will change several times before this project comes to completion. It is important to speak in abstract terms to the display to avoid being tied to one particular implementation.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method should clear the display of all rendered ADrawable elements.

      This method destroys the view.

      A method that will return whether or not items are focusable
      IDrawable getBackground()
      Gets the Frame's background so it can be redrawn
      java.awt.Frame getFrame()
      Gets the frame for use by the write-in GUI

      This method invalidates a given element.

      This method initializes and launches the view, putting the view into its event loop.

      Call this method to identify a drawable to use as the background image.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw(IDrawable element)
        Call this method to draw a Drawable element to the display.
        Parameters:
        element - This is the drawable that wishes to be drawn.

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(IDrawable element)
        This method invalidates a given element. Calling this method tells the view to reload the texture for a given element, then re-render the display
        Parameters:
        element - This is the element which is no longer valid. Reload this element's image and re-render it to the display

      • setBackground

        void setBackground(IDrawable element)
        Call this method to identify a drawable to use as the background image. This should not be a drawable that is used as an argument to "draw"
        Parameters:
        element - This is the element which will be identified as the background image.

      • register

        void register(EventType eventType,
            IEventHandler lambda)
        This method is the means that an outsider can use to register for an input event with the view. In our system, "registering for an event" involves asking a view to dispatch events of a certain abstract type to a queue that the requester provides.
        Parameters:
        eventType - This is the abstract event type that is being registered on.
        lambda - Execute this handler when the event happens.

      • clearDisplay

        void clearDisplay()
        This method should clear the display of all rendered ADrawable elements.

      • isWindowed

        boolean isWindowed()

      • run

        void run(java.lang.Runnable lambda)
        This method initializes and launches the view, putting the view into its event loop. Before the loop starts, and after the initialization, a given lambda is executed.
        Parameters:
        lambda - Run this lambda before the loop.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        This method destroys the view.

      • focusEnabled

        boolean focusEnabled()
        A method that will return whether or not items are focusable

      • getFrame

        java.awt.Frame getFrame()
        Gets the frame for use by the write-in GUI
        Returns:
        the frame

      • getBackground

        IDrawable getBackground()
        Gets the Frame's background so it can be redrawn
        Returns:
        the IDrawable background
